intro: Willoughbya hispida, commonly known as the rough willow tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, yellow flowers. The plant features rough, hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Willoughbya hispida is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its ecological significance includes providing habitat and food for various native wildlife species.
